stimulusHtml: A mutation in the upland cotton plant causes the development of chloroplasts with a single outer membrane and no internal membranes. Which of the following would most likely be observed in chloroplasts of cotton plants with this mutation?
choicesHtml: They would be unable to remove waste products, because internal transport proteins would not be present.
They would be unable to generate the ATP and NADPH needed to make sugars, because these processes occur on membranes within the chloroplast.
They would be unable to take up carbon dioxide, because CO2 is transported into the chloroplast in membrane-bound vesicles.
They would be unable to move within the cell, because only organelles with double membranes are mobile.
